title: NASA’s LRO Spots Likely Luna-25 Crash Site
summary: NASA’s Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter has spotted the likely crash site of Russia’s Luna-25 spacecraft on the Moon. Luna-25 was intended to make a soft landing near the Moon’s South Pole, […]

title: OSIRIS-REx teams conduct final rehearsals before sample capsule return in September
summary: The OSIRIS-REx spacecraft, launched in September 2016, is now less than a month away from bringing back samples from asteroid Bennu. NASA conducted a press conference on Aug. 30 to preview the Sept. 24 landing at the Dugway Proving Ground in Utah.

title: Ball, Northrop Grumman, Orbital Micro Systems and Spire claim NOAA contracts
summary: Ball Aerospace, Northrop Grumman, Orbital Micro Systems and Spire Global won contracts, announced Aug. 31, to design microwave sounders for the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration.

title: NASA to Discuss Psyche Asteroid Mission, Optical Communications Demo
summary: NASA will host a news conference at 1 p.m. EDT Wednesday, Sept. 6, to discuss the agency’s upcoming Psyche mission, which will be its first to visit a metal-rich asteroid. Riding along with Psyche is a laser transceiver for NASA’s Deep Space Optical Communications (DSOC) technology demonstration.

title: SBAG Wants Reconnaissance Mission to Apophis Before It Reaches Earth
summary: NASA’s Small Bodies Assessment Group is encouraging NASA to find a way to send a spacecraft to study the asteroid Apophis before it reaches Earth in 2029. Apophis will come […]

title: Space Tango names new CEO
summary: Space Tango, a Kentucky-based startup that conducts research and science experiments on the International Space Station, on Sept. 1 announced the appointment of S. Sita Sonty as its new chief executive officer.

title: Bezos snubbed Musk’s SpaceX over blockbuster satellite launch contract, Amazon shareholder says
summary: An Amazon shareholder lawsuit says the company snubbed SpaceX for valuable satellite launch contracts because of Jeff Bezos’ personal rivalry with Elon Musk, who has taunted his fellow billionaire’s space ambitions for years.

title: Pension fund sues Jeff Bezos and Amazon for not using Falcon 9 rockets
summary: Plaintiffs: Amazon decision "lays bare the extent" of Bezos’ personal rivalry with Musk.

title: What is the ESA Astronaut Policy?
summary:
In April, ESA signed a letter of intent with the Swedish National Space Agency to send an ESA astronaut aboard an Axiom mission to the International Space Station. In June, the agency announced that Marcus Wandt, a member of ESA’s newly formed astronaut reserves, had been selected to fly aboard the mission. This meant that […]
The post What is the ESA Astronaut Policy? appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Georgia, Texas Students to Hear from NASA Astronauts Aboard Station
summary: Students from Georgia and Texas will have separate opportunities next week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.
